intro: Psychotria diffusa var. agusanensis, commonly known as the Philippine psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is typically found in lowland and montane rainforests, growing in shaded, humid environments. It is notable for its chemical composition, containing various alkaloids, including ibogaine, which has been studied for its psychoactive properties. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
